section.title: Prerequisites
section.para: This documentation provides a description of session management within Ulteo OVD.
This is not an installation documentation. You need to have already installed a Session Manager and at least one Application Server and a File Server.
If you are not very familiar with Ulteo OVD architecture, the easiest way to setup OVD servers is by using the Virtual appliance.

section.title: Selecting Users
section.para: The first step before trying to start a sesssion is to go to the users page on the Administration Console and see which users are available. If you don't have any users, you need to create them or setup directory access, such as LDAP, for example.

simplesect.title: The "populate" Feature
simplesect.para: In the users page, you can see a section called Populate at the bottom. This feature is useful to quickly create default accounts.

simplesect.title: Configuring LDAP Access
simplesect.para: Instead of using default accounts or creating your own ones, you can also read the user base from an existing LDAP, Active Directory or eDirectory.
In order to do that, you have to go to the Settings page then Profile settings and setup the access. When complete, the users will appear in the users page.

section.title: Publishing Applications
section.para: A publication is an association between a user group and an applications group. It's an authorization for user groups' members to launch the applications included in the applications group.

By default, there is no user group or applications group installed (or if you choose to read the user groups from your directory) so you have to create these. It is the same process for both user groups and applications groups: first, you have to create a group by giving a name in the group page, then, you have to add users/applications in it.
Finally, you can switch on the Publication page (from users or applications main page) and associate user groups with applications groups.

section.title: Server Checks
section.para: On the previous step, we saw how to associate user groups with applications groups. The applications are installed on Application Server so you need to check on the Servers page if the servers you need are registered and in production state.

simplesect.title: Set a redirection name
simplesect.para: The server's redirection name is an option. If all your machines are in the same network, you don't have to change it.

important.para: If you installed your Application Server on the same machine as your Session Manager and you followed our directions, you defined 127.0.0.1 as the Session Manager host so you must define a redirection name.

simplesect.para: The redirection name is used to launch sessions. When you launch a session, you are redirected to an Application Server using the redirection name. In some cases the default redirection name (the FQDN you gave it during the Application Server installation) is not valid. For instance, if you setup a private IP address and you want to connect from the Internet.

section.para: To have a global overview off the publication and server status, it is a good idea to see the Summary page (from Status main section). This page shows for each user, which user group he belongs to, which applications and application groups he can access and finally there are online servers that match the published applications in order to be able to start a session.
